metadata.title: BOOTH: Comprehensive Market Research Report
metadata.subtitle: Tri-Cities Residential Real Estate Market Analysis
metadata.author: BOOTH Research Team

sections.title: Executive Summary
sections.tldr: The Tri-Cities region is experiencing robust 3.5% population growth, with Johnson City leading at $392K median home price, strong 9.8% consumer spending growth, and significant opportunities in lakefront properties.
content: The Tri-Cities region, comprising Johnson City, Kingsport, and Bristol, Tennessee, represents the most affordable market in East Tennessee with exceptional growth opportunities.
Regional population grew by 12,682 people from 2021-2023, with Johnson City leading at 73,635 residents and 3.6% growth since 2020.
Consumer spending surged 9.8% in 2023, nearly double the core inflation rate of 5.2%, indicating strong economic resilience and purchasing power.
Johnson City's median home price reached $392,000 in 2025, up 5.5% year-over-year, while maintaining affordability compared to national markets.
The region benefits from major economic anchors including Ballad Health (~15,000 employees), ETSU, and Eastman Chemical Company, providing economic stability and diverse employment opportunities.

Key opportunities include lakefront development (30% premium for Boone Lake properties), workforce housing initiatives, and downtown revitalization projects targeting young professionals and retirees.

sections.title: Regional Demographics
sections.tldr: Johnson City leads with 73,635 residents and 35.1 median age, attracting young professionals with $55,400 median household income and diverse age distribution.
content: Johnson City serves as the regional population center with 73,635 residents as of July 2024, representing 3.6% growth since 2020.
Kingsport follows with 57,109 residents (2.8% growth) and Bristol with 27,867 residents (2.7% growth), creating a combined metropolitan statistical area approaching 160,000.
The region's median age of 35.1 years in Johnson City indicates a healthy balance of working professionals and established families.
Median household income of $55,400 in Johnson City, while below national averages, provides strong purchasing power due to low cost of living.
Age distribution shows 29.7% of residents aged 18-34, indicating strong appeal to young professionals and families seeking affordable living with quality amenities.

sections.title: Economic Landscape
sections.tldr: Diverse economy anchored by Ballad Health (15,000 employees), ETSU, and Eastman Chemical, with 3.0% unemployment and 398 jobs added monthly in 2023.
content: The Tri-Cities economy demonstrates exceptional diversity with healthcare, education, and manufacturing serving as primary pillars of stability.
Ballad Health leads regional employment with approximately 15,000 employees across the healthcare system, including the flagship Johnson City Medical Center.
East Tennessee State University contributes over 2,500 direct employees plus significant economic impact through 15,000+ students and research activities.
Eastman Chemical Company in Kingsport employs approximately 7,000 workers, representing one of the region's largest manufacturing operations and global chemical industry leaders.
The region maintained a remarkably low 3.0% unemployment rate in early 2025, with consistent job growth averaging 398 new positions per month in 2023.
Labor force participation of 53% (December 2023) reflects both opportunities for workforce development and the stability of existing employment base.

sections.title: Residential Real Estate Market
sections.tldr: Johnson City leads at $392K median price (5.5% YoY growth), with healthy inventory levels and strong demand across all price segments.
content: Johnson City's residential market reached a median home price of $392,000 in 2025, reflecting 5.5% year-over-year appreciation and continued affordability relative to regional and national markets.
Kingsport offers more affordable options at $305,000 median price (January 2025), while Bristol remains the most accessible at $209,000, providing entry-level opportunities.
Market inventory shows healthy levels with 472 homes for sale in Johnson City and 465 in Kingsport (March 2025), representing month-over-month increases of 1.7% and 14.5% respectively.
Average days on market remain reasonable at 53 days in Johnson City and 63 days in Kingsport, indicating balanced market conditions without excessive buyer competition.
The market has experienced remarkable 72% growth from 2018-2024, demonstrating consistent appreciation while maintaining accessibility for local workforce.
Strong buyer demand comes from young professionals (25-34), pre-retirees (55-64), families, and remote workers attracted by the region's quality of life and affordability.

sections.title: Lakefront Real Estate Market
sections.tldr: Premium lakefront properties command 20-30% premiums ($250K-$1M+) with strong demand from retirees and second-home buyers across Boone, Watauga, and South Holston Lakes.
content: Lakefront properties represent the region's premium residential segment, with prices ranging from $250,000 to over $1,000,000 depending on location, size, and lake access.
Boone Lake properties command the highest premiums at approximately 30% above comparable inland homes, followed by Watauga Lake and South Holston Lake at 20-25% premiums.
Average days on market for lakefront properties extend to 75 days on Boone Lake and 60 days on Watauga Lake, reflecting the specialized nature of these luxury purchases.
Primary buyers include pre-retirees and retirees seeking permanent residences, affluent families purchasing second homes, and investors targeting vacation rental opportunities.
Key features driving lakefront demand include private docks, scenic mountain views, proximity to recreational activities, and the appeal of Tennessee's tax-friendly environment.
Development opportunities exist for both luxury custom homes and more accessible lakefront communities, particularly as remote work enables broader geographic flexibility for buyers.

sections.title: Market Dynamics & Consumer Preferences
sections.tldr: Consumer spending grew 9.8% in 2023, with buyers prioritizing home offices, energy efficiency, and scenic views as remote work reshapes housing demands.
content: Consumer spending increased 9.8% in 2023, significantly outpacing the core inflation rate of 5.2%, demonstrating strong regional economic health and disposable income growth.
Housing preferences have evolved to prioritize home offices, open floor plans, and high-speed internet connectivity, reflecting the permanent shift toward remote and hybrid work arrangements.
Energy-efficient designs and sustainable features increasingly influence buyer decisions, particularly among younger demographics seeking long-term cost savings.
Scenic views, proximity to outdoor recreation, and community amenities rank as top priorities for relocating buyers, leveraging the region's natural advantages.
Key spending categories beyond housing include dining, entertainment, and outdoor recreation, supporting local business growth and community development.

The region attracts diverse buyer demographics including young professionals seeking affordability, families prioritizing school quality and safety, and retirees drawn by tax advantages and recreational opportunities.

sections.title: Regional Infrastructure & Quality of Life
sections.tldr: Strong education system with highly-rated schools, expanding healthcare infrastructure, growing transportation networks, and abundant outdoor recreation amenities enhancing livability.
content: Education: Johnson City Schools rank among Tennessee's top-performing districts with 95% graduation rate and $12,500 per-pupil spending. The region hosts 3 universities including ETSU, King University, and Tusculum University.
Healthcare: Advanced medical infrastructure centered around Ballad Health's 21-hospital network, including the flagship Johnson City Medical Center with 514 beds and comprehensive specialty services.

Transportation: Strategic location at the intersection of I-26, I-81, and I-75, providing access to major Southeast markets. Regional airport (TRI) offers commercial flights to Charlotte, Atlanta, and Nashville.
Broadband: Citylink Fiber provides gigabit internet throughout Johnson City, while Charter Spectrum and other providers ensure reliable connectivity for remote workers and businesses.
Safety: Crime rates significantly below national averages - Johnson City reports 2.1 violent crimes per 1,000 residents (national average: 3.7), contributing to family-friendly appeal.
Recreation: 1,200+ acres of parks and greenways, three major lakes (Boone, Watauga, South Holston), Blue Ridge Parkway access, and proximity to Great Smoky Mountains National Park within 60 minutes.

sections.title: Market Trends & Forecasting
sections.tldr: Projected 4-6% annual home price appreciation through 2026, inventory stabilization expected, and emerging opportunities in workforce housing and sustainable development.
content: Price Forecasting: Conservative projections indicate 4-6% annual home price appreciation through 2026, driven by steady population growth and limited housing supply relative to demand.
Inventory Trends: Market inventory expected to stabilize at 3-4 months supply by late 2025, providing balanced conditions for both buyers and sellers after recent volatility.
Interest Rate Impact: Current mortgage rates in the 6.5-7.5% range are expected to moderate to 6.0-6.5% by 2026, potentially stimulating buyer activity and supporting price growth.
Demographic Shifts: 55+ relocations projected to increase 15% annually through 2027, driven by Tennessee's tax advantages and growing appeal among pre-retirees from higher-cost markets.
Development Pipeline: Over $200M in planned residential developments including 1,500+ units across workforce housing, senior living, and mixed-use projects scheduled for 2025-2027.

Investment Opportunity Areas: Short-term rental properties near lakes and downtown districts, workforce housing partnerships with major employers, and sustainable/energy-efficient home developments show strongest growth potential.

sections.title: Strategic Market Analysis
sections.tldr: Region leverages affordability, natural beauty, and economic diversity while addressing infrastructure challenges and housing workforce needs.
content: Strategic analysis reveals the Tri-Cities region's unique position as Tennessee's most affordable major market with exceptional growth potential and quality-of-life advantages.
The combination of natural assets, economic stability, and fiscal advantages creates a compelling value proposition for diverse buyer segments and business investments.

strengths: Affordability compared to national averages and regional competitors
Natural beauty and outdoor recreation (lakes, mountains, trails)
Stable economy with diverse sectors (healthcare, education, manufacturing)
No state income tax, attracting retirees and professionals
Strong community appeal and established quality of life
weaknesses: Lower median incomes compared to state and national averages
Aging population in Kingsport and Bristol creating demographic challenges
Limited affordable housing for local workforce relative to demand
Infrastructure strain from rapid population and development growth
Limited cultural amenities for diverse newcomers and young professionals
opportunities: Lakefront development for primary and vacation home markets
Workforce housing development to meet local employment demands
Downtown revitalization for urban living and mixed-use developments
Technology adoption (PropTech) to attract tech-savvy buyers and investors
Regional collaboration to promote unified market growth and tourism
threats: Economic volatility or potential recession affecting buyer confidence
Housing affordability challenges pricing out local workforce
Natural disaster risks including flooding and severe weather events
Regulatory changes affecting zoning, development, and property taxes
Competition from other regional markets (Asheville, NC; Knoxville, TN)

sections.title: Strategic Recommendations
sections.tldr: Focus on workforce housing, lakefront development, PropTech adoption, and regional collaboration to capitalize on growth while maintaining affordability.
content: Market stakeholders should prioritize workforce housing development through strategic partnerships with major employers like Ballad Health and ETSU to ensure sustainable growth.
Real estate professionals should leverage the region's lifestyle assets—lakes, mountains, schools, and community—to attract relocation buyers from higher-cost markets.
Adoption of virtual tours, digital closings, and PropTech solutions will enhance market competitiveness and appeal to tech-savvy buyers increasingly comfortable with remote transactions.
Niche market development, particularly 55+ communities and lakefront properties, presents significant opportunities for specialized developers and investors.
Downtown infill projects and mixed-use developments can capture young professional demand while revitalizing urban cores in Johnson City, Kingsport, and Bristol.
Regional collaboration among municipalities, economic development authorities, and real estate professionals will maximize marketing effectiveness and infrastructure development.
Zoning reforms and development incentives should focus on affordable housing creation while maintaining community character and environmental sustainability.
Investment in infrastructure improvements—broadband, transportation, utilities—will support continued growth while preventing development constraints.

sections.title: Market Outlook
sections.tldr: The Tri-Cities region offers compelling opportunities for sustainable growth, balancing affordability with quality of life in Tennessee's most accessible major market.
content: The Tri-Cities region stands uniquely positioned as Tennessee's most affordable major market with exceptional fundamentals for continued growth and investment success.
With population growth of 3.5%, diverse economic anchors, and strategic location advantages, the region offers sustainable opportunities for residents, businesses, and investors.
Key success factors include maintaining affordability while improving infrastructure, developing workforce housing, and leveraging natural assets for tourism and recreation.
The combination of economic stability, fiscal advantages, and quality of life creates a compelling value proposition that differentiates the Tri-Cities from competing regional markets.
Future growth depends on collaborative efforts to address infrastructure needs, housing accessibility, and workforce development while preserving the community character that attracts new residents.

Market participants who understand and leverage these regional advantages—affordability, natural beauty, economic diversity, and community appeal—are positioned for long-term success in this dynamic and growing market.
